intro: Jurinea anatolica, commonly known as the Anatolian sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Turkey. It belongs to the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, adapted to reduce water loss in dry environments. Jurinea anatolica is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is well-suited to harsh, semi-arid climates.
